body:
<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

<!-- Describe the issue -->
In the latest version v0.19.0.1, in Information window, the "Memory Pool" information says:
"Current number of transactions N/A"
and
"Memory usage N/A"

I am able to run comands to see transactions in mempool, so its there, so should not say "N/A"

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->
"Current number of transactions" and "Memory usage" should show values.

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->
See screenshot

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->
I rebooted machine, I restarted Bitcoin Core several times. It still says "N/A".

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->
 v0.19.0.1, downloaded from bitcoin.org website. Downloaded the 64bit EXE file

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->
Windows 10, Intel Core i7-7700 @ 3.60 GHz, SSD for app and Samsung M2 for data.

<!-- GUI-related issue? What is your operating system and its version? If Linux, what is your desktop environment and graphical shell? -->
See above

<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->
[debug.log](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/files/3891062/debug.log)
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6368514/69617250-37498700-1038-11ea-9e85-1c8829268765.PNG)

I can be contacted at zeven74@gmail.com for any questions or information.
title: Memory pool information update does not work
